http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: "It started with a spot of tea. It ended in tragedy when the wealthy Rex Fortescue sipped his last cup, fell ill, and died. The only clue: a pocketful of rye found on the victim. The murder seemed without rhyme or reason--until the shrewd Miss Marple recalled that delightful nursery rhyme 'Sing a Song of Sixpence.' A playful hint, indeed. But the spinster sleuth knew that murder was anything but child's play..."--Page 4 of cover.
